Founders / Founding Members: Newcastle United Football Club was founded on 9 December 1892 following the merger of two local clubs, Newcastle East End and Newcastle West End, to become the primary professional football club in the city of Newcastle upon Tyne.
About the Club: Newcastle United Football Club is a professional football club based in Newcastle upon Tyne, England, competing in the Premier League. Founded in 1892, the club has a long and storied history in English football, known for passionate support, iconic black and white striped kits, and memorable stadium atmosphere at St James' Park. Newcastle have enjoyed periods of domestic success, particularly in the early 20th century, and have been competitive across major competitions. Under head coach Eddie Howe, who has been in charge since 2021, Newcastle ended a decades-long domestic trophy drought by winning the EFL Cup in 2025 — their first major trophy since 1955 — and secured qualification for the UEFA Champions League on multiple occasions. The club’s recent resurgence under new ownership and management has rekindled ambitions for sustained success at both domestic and European levels.
